name: SERP Video Downloader
tagline: Download videos, images, and audio from 1,000+ sites with one extension.
description:
SERP Downloader is the all-in-one browser extension for people who need the fastest path from “I’m watching it now” to “I have the file saved forever.” It recognises 1,000+ streaming, social, and file-hosting providers, unwraps whatever format they use—HLS, DASH, progressive MP4, WebM, audio-only, or zipped image galleries—and returns clean downloads that match the original quality.

Under the hood the extension keeps an up-to-date provider manifest, smartly routes each request through the right extractor, and merges segmented media without the user touching a command line. Teams can queue bulk jobs, monitor state from a single dashboard, and store recipes for recurring tasks so the same workflow works for the next platform that pops up.

faqs.question: How many providers does SERP Downloader actually support?
faqs.answer: The catalog tracks 1,000+ actively verified providers across streaming, social, course, and cloud file platforms. Every release ships with automated regression tests so the list keeps growing while existing sites stay compatible.

faqs.question: Can I add my own private or niche platform?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can define custom recipes with the URL patterns, headers, and extractor logic you need. Once saved, they appear in the same picker as the built-in providers.

faqs.question: What happens when a site changes its player or manifests?
faqs.answer: We monitor breaking changes with heartbeat tests, roll out extractor updates through the manifest service, and notify you in-app. Critical fixes can be pulled down without waiting for a full store review.

faqs.question: Does it capture subtitles, chapters, or metadata?
faqs.answer: Subtitle, chapter, and metadata scraping is built-in. The extension exports SRT/VTT tracks, chapter markers, and JSON sidecars so editors and translators can keep context intact.

faqs.question: Are there download limits or throttling?
faqs.answer: No artificial limits are imposed. SERP Downloader respects the provider’s rate limits and retries automatically, but you can queue as many jobs as your connection and storage allow.

faqs.question: How does authentication work for members-only content?
faqs.answer: The extension forwards your existing session cookies and can store per-provider auth headers securely. If you can view the content in your browser, SERP Downloader can pull the same files without bypassing permissions.

faqs.question: Which operating systems and browsers are supported?
faqs.answer: Chrome, Edge, Brave, Arc, Firefox, and other Chromium-based browsers on Windows, macOS, and Linux are supported. Safari support is on the roadmap once Manifest V3 parity lands.

permission_justifications.justification: Writes completed media files, subtitles, and metadata bundles directly to your downloads folder with resume support for long jobs.
Caches provider manifests, queued jobs, and recipe presets locally so workflows persist across browser sessions.
Injects the SERP Downloader controls into the page you are viewing and reads media descriptors only for that context.
Detects when you switch videos or open playlists in new tabs so queued downloads keep pointing at the right source.
Extracts manifests, signed URLs, and media segments from complex players without exposing data to external services.
Rewrites streaming requests when providers use obscured segment paths or token refreshers, ensuring downloads stay stable.
Limits privileged access to whitelisted provider domains and the manifest update endpoint required for extractor updates.
